subject: Sales
title: Reading Buyer Body Language
description: A short lesson to help you apply Reading Buyer Body Language.

buildup.text: Buyer body language reveals interest, doubt, or disengagement â€” often before they speak a word.

discovery.text: Clusters matter more than single gestures. One crossed arm means little. A set of closed signals matters.

twist.text: Misreading cues is dangerous. Cultural differences change body language rules dramatically.

climax.text: Watch for sudden shifts. A posture change during your pitch means you just hit or missed a nerve.

punchline.text: Read the body, not just the words.

quiz.question: Why should you focus on gesture clusters rather than single cues?
options: Single gestures can be random; clusters reveal true sentiment
